Module cish.lang
Package org.alindner.cish.lang

Class IO

java.lang.Object
org.alindner.cish.lang.IO
public class IO
extends Object
A class which holds static methods to interact with the filesystem
Since:
0.5.3
Author:
alindner

    • toOctal

      public static String toOctal​(int charAt)
      converts a number, given as char, to it's unix octal permission representation.

      this number can be shown by using 

      ls -l
      and 
      stat -c '%a %n' *
      or 
      ls -l | awk '{k=0;for(i=0;i<=8;i++)k+=((substr($1,i+2,1)~/[rwx]/) 2^(8-i));if(k)printf("%0o",k);print}'
      Parameters:
      charAt - number representation
      Returns:
      octal representation

    • executable

      public static boolean executable​(String file, boolean isExecutable)
      make a given file executable
      Parameters:
      file - file
      isExecutable - should the file be executable
      Returns:
      true if it was successful

    • isDirectory

      public static boolean isDirectory​(Path path)
      Tests whether a file is a directory.

      By default, symbolic links are followed and the file attribute of the final target of the link is read.

      Parameters:
      path - the path to the file to test
      Returns:
      true if the file is a directory; false if the file does not exist, is not a directory, or it cannot be determined if the file is a directory or not.
      Throws:
      SecurityException - In the case of the default provider, and a security manager is installed, its checkRead method denies read access to the file.
      See Also:
      Files.isDirectory(Path, LinkOption...)

    • createAsFile

      public static Path createAsFile​(Path path)
      Create a non existing path as file and returns the absolute path.

      it will create any parent directories if needed

      Parameters:
      path - file path
      Returns:
      the normalised, absolute file path
      Since:
      0.7.0

    • touch

      public static Path touch​(Path basePath, String fileName)
      touch / create a given file relative to the given basePath
      Parameters:
      basePath - the base path where to given file will be touched
      fileName - the filename
      Since:
      0.7.0
